description:
Join Nancy Guthrie as she talks with scholar and author Vern Poythress about reading the book of Revelation not as a puzzle book to be figured out but as a picture book which should stir us up to be moved by Christ's rule and God's plan for history.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/blessedpodcast/

title: The Marriage Imagery of Revelation with Jonathan Gibson | Season 1, Episode 5
description:
Join Nancy Guthrie as she talks with 

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/blessedpodcast/

title: The Theology of the Book of Revelation with Tom Schreiner | Season 1, Episode 4
description:
Join Nancy Guthrie as she talks with scholar and author Thomas Schreiner about how our reading of the book of Revelation is impacted by our theology of the Trinity, judgment, and eschatology.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/blessedpodcast/

title: How the Old Testament Helps us Make Sense of Revelation with Andrew Sach | Season 1, Episode 3
description:
Join Nancy Guthrie as she talks with pastor and author Andrew Sach about how the more we keep our eyes and ears open for Old Testament imagery and allusions, the less strange the book of Revelation will seem.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/blessedpodcast/

title: The Apocalyptic Nature of Revelation with Iain Duguid | Season 1, Episode 2
description:
Join Nancy Guthrie as she talks with pastor, professor, and author Iain Duguid about how we can understand Revelation in new ways when we read it as a letter, as a promise, and as apocalyptic prophecy.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/blessedpodcast/

title: Why Study the Book of Revelation? | Season 1, Episode 1
description:
Join best-selling author and speaker Nancy Guthrie as she discusses the book of Revelation and how we actually can understand its central message, encouraging us to see the world through the perspective of heaven and to accept the blessing promised to those who “hear and keep” this book.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/blessedpodcast/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 150 - Let Everything Praise the Lord
description:
The God of the Psalms—the God who meets the desperate, the God who hears the distraught—took on flesh and blood. He came for us. He came for you. This is who he is. Praise the Lord.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: ESV Psalms, Photography Edition
description: Learn more: crossway.org/ESVPsalmsPhotographyEd

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 149 - Sing to the Lord a New Song
description:
The arresting reminder of this psalm is of how low God’s people have been and often are, combined with how high a role God has destined for them.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 148 - Praise the Name of the Lord
description:
The world in which we live is filled with inexhaustible detail and glory and beauty and diversity. Who would think that the same Being could have thought up the lion and the flamingo? The snowflake and the sun?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 147 - He Heals the Brokenhearted
description:
The world runs after strength, slickness, outward appearance, impressiveness. God runs to the brokenhearted.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 146 - Put Not Your Trust in Princes
description:
Are you in distress? Are you overwhelmed? Marinate your heart in the power and love of the Savior.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 145 - Great Is the Lord
description:
The ministry of Jesus on behalf of sinners and sufferers means you are safe. In Christ, you cannot lose. Even your pain will ultimately be transformed into your own glory and triumph.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 144 - My Rock and My Fortress
description:
All it takes for God to be our fortress is for us to let him be so. To trust him. To turn, once more, to him. To humble ourselves and let him deliver us.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 143 - My Soul Thirsts for You
description:
In Christ, we are righteous with a status earned and given to us irrespective of what we bring to the table. All we need to offer is our need.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 142 - You Are My Refuge
description:
Go to God through the mediator, Jesus, who knows your anguish and has known even deeper anguish himself.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 141 - Give Ear to My Voice
description:
Liberated by the gospel of grace, we are free to look to God in our present interpersonal strife, even when we know ourselves to be wronged.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 140 - Deliver Me, O Lord, from Evil Men
description:
Christ is your king, representing God to you, but he is also your priest, representing you to God. He is worthy of all our trust.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 139 - Search Me, O God, and Know My Heart
description:
If you are in Christ, the deepest reality of your existence is that God knows you. He knows every nook and cranny of your heart. He knows every failure, every fear. He understands you. He does not merely know about you. He knows you.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 138 - Give Thanks to the Lord
description:
Where is God’s glory seen? In his greatness, to be sure: his omnipotence, his infinitude, his eternality. Even more, however, the glory of God is seen in his goodness in light of that greatness. In all his immensity, he delights to shower his wayward creatures with grace upon grace.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 137 - How Shall We Sing the Lord’s Song?
description:
The Bible is a real book about a real God who sent a real Son to rescue real sinners from real evil. It is not a fairy book. The Bible is a book you can trust, for it reveals to us a God we can trust.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 136 - His Steadfast Love Endures Forever
description:
“His love endures forever.” Beyond our failures. Beyond our resentments. Beyond our disgust with ourselves. Beyond the love of any friend.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 135 - Your Name, O Lord, Endures Forever
description:
Those who yield to and trust in Jesus Christ, God’s perfect image, begin to take on his characteristics, like gentleness, love, and justice. We become truly human.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 134 - Come, Bless the Lord
description:
To bless the Lord is to lift one’s eyes to heaven, to look to God, to celebrate who he is, to count on him for all things, to acknowledge life as a gift from him. It is to thank him. At a base level, it is to notice him. To see him, and to rejoice in him while doing so.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 133 - When Brothers Dwell in Unity
description:
How do we find such unity? The whole Bible gives us the answer, hinted at in this psalm: unity comes where “the Lord has commanded the blessing”.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 132 - The Lord Has Chosen Zion
description:
Who rules over your life? Who will determine the final state of the world? Who gets the last say? Jesus Christ—not your boss, not your parents, not your political leadership. Trust him, and be at peace.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 131 - I Have Calmed and Quieted My Soul
description:
What in your life is pulling you away from saying, “I have calmed and quieted my soul”? Repent. Be restored. Return to the Lord. Hope in him once more.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 130 - My Soul Waits for the Lord
description:
Your sins can darken your awareness of God’s love, but they cannot darken the reality of that love. God does not redeem his people from some of their iniquities; rather, “he will redeem Israel from all his iniquities”.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 129 - They Have Afflicted Me from My Youth
description:
If you are in Christ—if you are one of those on whom the blessing of the Lord rests—then, like your Savior before you, your pains will one day be transformed into glory, turned inside out into marks of beauty.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 128 - Blessed Is Everyone Who Fears the Lord
description:
What does it mean to “fear the Lord”? To fear the Lord means to live as if God exists and is who he says he is.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 127 - Unless the Lord Builds the House
description:
Build into your life self-conscious, moment-by-moment mindfulness of the Lord. Appeal to him constantly. Invite him into your thoughts and dreams and plans.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 126 - Restore Our Fortunes, O Lord
description:
Life in Christ is a celebration—not shallow merriment but a deep, pain-acknowledging celebration. For the best is yet to come.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 125 - The Lord Surrounds His People
description:
What does it mean to be part of the people of God? Among a hundred other things, it means that the God who created the universe never ceases to watch over and actively protect you.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 124 - Our Help Is in the Name of the Lord
description:
The Father sent his own Son so that amid all our ups and downs in life, we are guaranteed a steady companion who loves us and is for us. He is on our side. “Our help is in the name of the Lord”.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 123 - Our Eyes Look to the Lord Our God
description:
The mercy of the Lord is yours for the taking. Draw near to him, and he will draw near to you. In the embrace of God is a comfort and consolation no human scorning can threaten.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 122 - Let Us Go to the House of the Lord
description:
In Jesus, we become our true selves. We are given back our humanity. We taste Eden. And in the new earth, we will enjoy unhindered fellowship with God once more, not in a limited locale but unlimited, not for a limited time but for eternity.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 121 - My Help Comes from the Lord
description:
What does it mean to be part of the people of God? Among a hundred other things, it means that the God who created the universe never ceases to watch over and actively protect you.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 120 - Deliver Me, O Lord
description:
Like our Savior, who left his true home in heaven to come to earth and sojourn among us, we sojourn among a foreign land that will one day be returned fully and openly to its rightful ruler. Until then, we trust in the Lord and, led by the psalmist, pray for deliverance.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 119 - Your Word Is a Lamp to My Feet
description:
Having redeemed his people and brought us through grace into relationship with him, God now lovingly instructs us in the way to enjoy fullness of life.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 118 - His Steadfast Love Endures Forever
description:
Have you been rejected, today, by someone who ought to have accepted you? You are in good company. Take heart. God draws near to you in his rejected, crucified Son.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 117 - The Lord’s Faithfulness Endures Forever
description:
If grace is truly gracious, then you are permanently forgiven, liberated, rinsed clean. Let your delight in this freedom bubble over into telling others of what they too might enjoy.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 116 - I Love the Lord
description:
We will remember that the phrase “Gracious is the Lord” went from abstract truth to concrete reality in the incarnation. Then God really came out of heaven into our pain. Could he possibly have given us more reason to trust and love him?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 115 - To Your Name Give Glory
description:
Only in Christ are we truly secure. Trust in him. Hope in him. Bank on him. Only he will never let you down.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 114 - Tremble at the Presence of the Lord
description:
The natural elements can intimidate even mature adults. Many of us have driven through intense downpours of rain or been woken up to a peal of thunder right overhead. This psalm insists, however, that the Lord uses the natural elements to care for us, to serve us.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 113 - Who Is like the Lord Our God?
description:
Are you distraught? Are you perplexed by life? The Lord of heaven is drawn like a magnet to your distress. Open up to him. Welcome him into your need.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 112 - The Righteous Will Never Be Moved
description:
For those who trust in the Lord—those who take all of their cowering anxieties and cast them upon God—this life is like the first rays of sunshine coming over the horizon at five o’clock in the morning on a warm summer day.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 111 - Great Are the Lord's Works
description:
The Bible is a message of gracious redemption from start to finish. Scripture is not an advice column at the back of the newspaper; it is the front page, declaring news of what God has done.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 110 - Sit at My Right Hand
description:
Christ is your king, representing God to you, but he is also your priest, representing you to God. He is worthy of all our trust.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 109 - Help Me, O Lord My God
description:
When our crucified and risen king comes again, our accusers will be silenced once and for all. We will have peace.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 108 - With God We Shall Do Valiantly
description:
Vain is the salvation of man. But with God on our side, we shall triumph.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 107 - Let the Redeemed of the Lord Say So
description:
Anyone who by God’s grace can humble himself to receive Christ’s work as a free gift will be forgiven and glorified and will enjoy the new heavens and the new earth. But the only way in is to get low. The proud—those who believe they deserve heaven—are the very ones who do not.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 106 - Give Thanks to the Lord, for He Is Good
description:
Jesus endured the agony of separation from the Father so that you and I can stand under the fountain of a loving God. All it takes is asking for it. Opening yourself up to it. This is who he is.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 105 - Tell of All His Wondrous Works
description:
God’s grace and our obedience are not equal balances on a scale. God’s grace is inexhaustible, endless. God’s grace always outpaces any grateful response on our part. It is precisely for this reason that we delight to live in holiness and reverence.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 104 - O Lord My God, You Are Very Great
description:
Consider your life. Have you compartmentalized the Lord of heaven? Have you set him off as one part of your life, as you have your finances, work, entertainment, and so on? Return to what you know to be true.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 103 - Bless the Lord, O My Soul
description:
We are sinners. We sin. But in Christ our basic identity is not sinner but cleansed, whole. And as we step out into a new day in soul-calm because of that free gift of cleansing, we find that strangely, startlingly, we begin to “do his commandments”.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 102 - Do Not Hide Your Face from Me
description:
The grace of God grants a significance that transcends our brief little lives. For we have been united to Christ. His future now determines our future.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 101 - I Will Walk with Integrity
description:
It is impossible to move through life with a primary focus on the things of this world yet still grow in integrity. But when one keeps one’s eyes focused on God—his character, his promises, his mighty rule, his heart of grace for sinners—all of life comes into accord. Things fall into place.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 100 - His Steadfast Love Endures Forever
description:
Your pain never outpaces his love. Your difficulty is surrounded by the deeper reality of his goodness. He proved it by sending his own Son for you. Even in the pain of life, we lift our hearts and our voices to the Lord.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 99 - The Lord Our God Is Holy
description:
We today are led by the psalmist to “exalt the Lord our God”, but we do it with the greater knowledge that we are priests to the world—and this is true only because God sent his own Son to become the true and final great high priest, the priest who offered the ultimate sacrifice of his own life.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 98 - Make a Joyful Noise to the Lord
description:
God’s global grace is reason for deep encouragement. Anyone can get in on this—as long as he does not try to barter with God but rather humbles himself enough to simply receive his love freely.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 97 - The Lord Reigns
description:
Is your vision of God diminishing? Do you find the ceiling of your view of his glory lowering? Confess your small-mindedness to God and perhaps also to a trusted Christian friend. Consider who he is. Glory in him again.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 96 - Worship in the Splendor of Holiness
description:
At the cross of Jesus Christ, God has already taken care of your own sins and need for judgment. Final judgment is now to be anticipated with eagerness, not feared with trepidation.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 95 - Let Us Sing Songs of Praise
description:
Are you grumbling today? Murmuring? Do you find yourself nursing wounds, wondering why God has made your life so hard? Repent. Consider that God is the one who formed the earth and made you. Above all, consider the divine “work” that you have experienced: the gracious giving of his own Son to suffer for your sins and restore you to himself.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Introducing ESV Heirloom Bibles
description: Learn more: crossway.org/ESVHeirloomBibles

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 94 - The Lord Will Not Forsake His People
description:
If you are in Christ, you have in full sight the supreme consolation of God—the coming of Jesus Christ to love and deliver you from all your sins, and his indwelling Spirit to comfort and direct you all your days.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 93 - The Lord Reigns
description:
This psalm speaks of the earth as God’s throne. On it he sits, ruling, comfortable, issuing commands and decrees. He orders the world; the world does not order him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 92 - How Great Are Your Works
description:
Bring to Jesus your worries, your cares. Unload your burdens on him. Above all, give him your sins.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 91 - My Refuge and My Fortress
description:
Amid the storms of life, God is a safe and serene harbor. Have you experienced this? Or are you internally frenetic?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 90 - From Everlasting to Everlasting
description:
Love those whom you see today. Dignify them. Rejoice in them. You are planting seeds that will grow and blossom into eternity.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 89 - I Will Sing of the Steadfast Love of the Lord
description:
Jesus is the king, the leader of God’s people whose throne truly will never come to an end. And if you trust in Christ, his fate belongs also to you. You will share in his resurrection, his glory, his rule.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 88 - I Cry Out Day and Night Before You
description:
For us today, we see with the full light of day the length to which God was willing to go to ensure that we would never be truly alone, no matter our folly, no matter our stupidity. For Jesus endured Psalm 88. He really endured it. On our behalf.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 87 - Glorious Things of You Are Spoken
description:
Throughout the Bible, God’s city represents a place of safety and refuge. Indeed, the city of God becomes one of the chief metaphors for salvation itself. “Glorious things” are not spoken of Zion simply because of architectural beauty or geographical location. Zion represents God himself, in all his mercy, offered to sinners. In him we take refuge.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 86 - Great Is Your Steadfast Love
description:
As you ponder your sinfulness, ponder his graciousness—a grace that ever outstrips even your sin.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 85 - Revive Us Again
description:
Are you feeling dead and dry? Pray Psalm 85. Meditate on it in the morning and in the evening. After all, God has proven that he will not let such a prayer go unanswered.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 84 - My Soul Longs for the Courts of the Lord
description:
God is above you, illumining—“a sun.” God is before you, protecting—“a shield.” God is for you, dignifying—he “bestows favor and honor.” God is with you, lavishing—“no good thing does he withhold.”

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 83 - O God, Do Not Keep Silence
description:
In Christ we are invincible, for Jesus was raised bodily, and we are now united to him by faith. Our future could not be brighter, whatever adversity washes over us in this fallen world.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 82 - Rescue the Weak and Needy
description:
Having been delivered from the greatest bondage—spiritual bondage—we become delighted and privileged to care for those in a lesser but real bondage—physical and material bondage.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 81 - Oh, That My People Would Listen to Me
description:
When Christ came, he said he came to give life; he said he was the fountain of living water, the bread from heaven. You were made for him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 80 - Restore Us, O God
description:
Do you feel forsaken, as if you keep disappointing God? Consider what God has done for you if you are in Christ. You are vitally connected to the life of heaven. Trust him. Enjoy him. Bear fruit. It is who you now are.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 79 - How Long, O Lord?
description:
Jesus has washed away any reason for God to be angry with us in a punishing kind of way. Everything in your life, good and pain, comfortable and painful, is from the hand of a loving Father.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 78 - Tell the Coming Generation
description:
In him you are restored to your true self. Your sins are forgiven. You are promised an eternity in the new earth. Read this psalm and praise God for his goodness to Israel—and to you.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 77 - In the Day of Trouble I Seek the Lord
description:
In the Old Testament, his way was through the sea. In the New Testament, his way is through the cross. The gracious provision of God confounds us even as it delivers us.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Marriage Is a Place for Joyful Sacrifice
description: Learn more: crossway.org/Marriage

title: A Good Marriage Needs These 2 Things
description: Learn more: crossway.org/Marriage

title: What Is the Central Hope for Your Marriage?
description: Learn more: crossway.org/Marriage

title: The Best Premarital Advice Is Bad News
description: Learn more: crossway.org/Marriage

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 76 - Who Can Stand Before You?
description:
The ferocious wrath of God landed on Christ, not us. As a result, God can take up residence within us without threatening his holiness or justice.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 75 - God Will Judge with Equity
description:
God judged his own righteous Son in place of us unrighteous rebels, so that any who turns to take refuge in him gets the future that Jesus deserves. This, above all else, is reason to give thanks to God for his wondrous deeds.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 74 - Arise, O God, Defend Your Cause
description:
In the destruction of Jesus, your own destruction is assured to be behind you instead of in front of you. When you look at the cross, you see your punishment being carried out, so that before you is only peace with God and an eternity with him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 73 - God Is My Strength and Portion Forever
description:
Your greatest enjoyment—God—can never be taken away from you. In heaven, God is all you want and need. On earth, God is all you want and need. In death or in life, in sickness or in health, even as your body wastes away toward the grave, God is all you want and need.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 72 - Give the King Your Justice
description:
Only one king ever lived up to this lofty prayer. In the Lord Jesus, we see the supreme promises of God come to climactic realization.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 71 - Forsake Me Not When My Strength Is Spent
description:
Adversity is not intended to diminish our hope in God. Adversity is intended to heighten our hope in him. We are brought to remember that God is all we have, and that he is enough.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 70 - O Lord, Do Not Delay
description:
Consider your own life. On what do you rely, moment by moment? True communion with God is the lifelong process of growing more and more deeply in dependence upon God: leaning on him, trusting in him, counting on him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 69 - Save Me, O God
description:
In your time of distress, you can pray this Psalm and know with confidence that God will somehow answer and deliver you, because Jesus prayed for deliverance but faced the cross nevertheless.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 68 - God Shall Scatter His Enemies
description:
What difference does it make that God is both mighty and merciful, both powerful and gentle? All the difference in the world. It means he is able to deliver us from all our difficulties and sins, and it means he enjoys delivering us.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 67 - Make Your Face Shine upon Us
description:
This is who God is. He is not a parochial, narrow-minded God. His welcome to sinners is wide. He asks only for our penitent faith, our trusting contrition—all he asks is that we humble ourselves enough to know of our need for his saving mercy.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Introducing 'Be Thou My Vision: A Liturgy for Daily Worship' by Jonathan Gibson
description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/be-thou-my-vision-cob/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 66 - How Awesome Are Your Deeds
description:
Are you in a valley now? Do you feel now that you are fighting your way “through fire and through water"? Take comfort in this Psalm. Through tears he brings us “to a place of abundance.”

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 65 - O God of Our Salvation
description:
God cares for you. He does not care about our souls alone, although that is the most important thing about us. He cares also about our physical nourishment.Yet why did he give us food, ultimately? Not only for our enjoyment but more deeply to tell us who he is—our true sustenance, our deepest nourishment.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 64 - Hide Me from the Wicked
description:
Our words reveal what is truly happening in our hearts, far better than any X-ray. When our immediate verbal response is to respond to evil with evil, we demonstrate that we are not in tune with the gospel.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 63 - My Soul Thirsts for You
description:
The heart of Christianity is not a set of doctrines to believe, even though sound doctrine is vital. Nor is the heart of Christianity an activity to pursue, even though the Christian faith is necessarily active. The heart of Christianity is to live upon God. You were made for God.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 62 - My Soul Waits for God Alone
description:
Pain has a special way of exposing where our trust truly lies. But pain also brings us into our only secure trust: the Lord himself.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 61 - Lead Me to the Rock
description:
How do you handle distress — emotional, psychological, physical, financial? What is your heart-impulse when you feel swamped by adversity? Cry out to the Lord. He will lead you to a place of safety.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 60 - He Will Tread Down Our Foes
description:
Ultimately, through Jesus Christ, God fulfills his promises to Abraham, and the New Testament indicates that God’s way of continuing to fulfill his land promises is through faithful Christian witness, extending not just to the Promised Land of Israel but to the end of the earth.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 59 - Deliver Me from My Enemies
description:
If we have pains we do not deserve, how much more does the holy God not deserve the pains of our own failure to defend him and praise him and follow him wholeheartedly?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 58 - God Who Judges the Earth
description:
God will right all wrongs. The final judgment of God is a deeply liberating doctrine. All will be put to right. We can release the need to judge now. We can leave it in his wise hands.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 55 - Cast Your Burden on the Lord
description:
Betrayals happen every day on this earth, but there is one Friend who we know will never betray us. Open up to him, fellowship with him, pour out your heart to him. He will not let you down.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 54 - The Lord Upholds My Life
description:
Instead of looking around for some other person or group of people to protect him, David looks to God. His eyes go up, not out.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 53 - There Is None Who Does Good
description:
If you feel yourself to be under the indictment of this psalm, this is all that is needed to receive the mercy of God in Jesus Christ. To the degree that you know your sin, to that degree you may enjoy amazing grace.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 52 - The Steadfast Love of God Endures
description:
To trust God means to live your life as if God actually exists and is who he says he is. It is to conduct your existence in such a way that what you say that you believe about God aligns with how you use words, money, your body, and other people. It is to leave your final welfare in God’s hands rather than your own.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 57 - Let Your Glory Be over All the Earth
description:
In the midst of difficulty, the Holy Spirit delights to bring us into this settled place of contentment: as long as God is exalted, all is well. As long as he is known and lifted up and honored, my own welfare need not worry me too much.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 56 - In God I Trust
description:
This psalm lists different reasons not to be afraid. One striking remark from David addresses the tender nearness of God. Consider the beautiful imagery David uses.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 51 - Create in Me a Clean Heart, O God
description:
Amid your dirtiness, you are free to breathe again. In Christ, you are rinsed clean—invincibly, permanently, irreversibly.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 50 - God Himself Is Judge
description:
God  wants us to honor him simply by crying out for help: “Call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify me.” We glorify God by being delivered by him—which reminds us of the deepest reason for the sacrificial system. 

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 49 - Why Should I Fear in Times of Trouble?
description:
Jesus Christ left the beauty of heaven to walk through the brokenness of this fallen world. And he went willingly to a Roman cross to ransom sinners from the clutches of death and hell and condemnation. The price he paid—his own dear life—is costly enough to win back the lives of all of those who repent and trust in him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 48 - Zion, the City of Our God
description:
Do you live in a city? A town? A village? God does not simply dwell among you, in some special building. He dwells in you. He could not be closer.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 47 - God Is King over All the Earth
description:
One day, through the salvation wrought in Jesus Christ, the true and final descendant of Abraham, God will welcome into the new heavens and the new earth a beautiful international diversity of ethnicities.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 46 - God Is Our Fortress
description:
What worries your heart as you lie awake in bed? God says: I, not any circumstantial solution, am your refuge amid your adversities. I am a very present help in trouble. I am God. Be still.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 45 - Your Throne, O God, Is Forever
description:
Jesus is the ideal king. Even today, when most nations are not under the rule of a pure monarchy, this is the king, the ruler, every human heart longs for. A king of justice and of virtue, of might and of beauty.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 44 - Come to Our Help
description:
Fallen men and women stand in need of a salvation that comes wholly from outside of them. They contribute nothing but their need.When God’s people stand in need of fresh deliverance, therefore, this is all they can plead: “Rise up; come to our help! Redeem us for the sake of your steadfast love!"

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 43 - Send Out Your Light and Your Truth
description:
The Hebrew word for “salvation” here reads literally “the salvation of my face.” God does not save me in ethereal abstraction. He draws near to me, so near that the Bible describes it in terms of saving my very face. 

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 42 - Why Are You Cast Down, O My Soul?
description:
The tidal wave of true separation from the Father washed over Another so that it need never wash over us.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Introducing New Morning Mercies (Note-Taking Edition)
description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/new-morning-mercies-hcj-2/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 41 - O Lord, Be Gracious to Me
description:
David knew only in shadows what we know in full light: even though he would one day die and be buried in the ground, he will indeed be raised up by the mercy of God.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 40 - My Help and My Deliverer
description:
The greater Son of David came into this world and never faltered from doing the will of God. He then suffered what our sin deserves and rose triumphant from the grave.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 39 - What Is the Measure of My Days?
description:
For God is the one hope of this life who will not, in the end, let us down.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 38 - Do Not Forsake Me, O Lord
description:
God’s answer for those who squander his grace through folly is: more grace. In Jesus, this unending fountain of inexhaustible grace has been secured.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 37 - He Will Not Forsake His Saints
description:
The core message of this psalm is that true fullness of life comes not as we expect. It is found not in manipulating our circumstances or controlling those around us or violently silencing those who threaten our ambitions but in quietly looking to God and letting him sort out our lives.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Doctrine of God

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 36 - How Precious Is Your Steadfast Love
description:
aWith this psalm David brings us with him into a renewed, settled confidence that it is the Lord who will triumph in our lives. He will care for us. He will get the last word.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Preview - 'Deeper: Real Change for Real Sinners' by Dane Ortlund
description:
In a special bonus episode, Crossway presents an audio preview of Dane Ortlund's new book Deeper: Real Change for Real Sinners.

Dane points believers to Christ, making the case that sanctification does not happen by doing more or becoming better, but by going deeper into the wondrous gospel truths that washed over them when they were first united to him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/deeper

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 35 - Great Is the Lord
description:
David is under assault, and once more he turns to God for deliverance. His own human resources are no match for the adversity he is facing—he must appeal to the only one who has the strength to protect him and overcome his adversaries.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 34 - Taste and See That the Lord Is Good
description:
To look to the Lord and be radiant as a result is to walk through life in happy defiance of any circumstantial adversity sending your emotional life into meltdown. You have God. You are safe. You have everything.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 33 - The Steadfast Love of the Lord
description:
Over all the madness and chaos of this world, all the political conflicts and military endeavors and voting booths and family dysfunctions and physical illnesses and financial meltdowns—God reigns.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 32 - Blessed Are the Forgiven
description:
In the fullness of time God sent his own Son to be our sacrificial Lamb. In him we receive forgiveness because the punishment we deserved was poured out on him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Introducing Unfolding Grace for Kids
description: Learn more: crossway.org/bibles/unfolding-grace-for-kids-hc/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 31 - Into Your Hand I Commit My Spirit
description:
What does it mean to “take refuge” in God, as David says numerous times in this psalm? What does it mean that God is our “fortress”?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 30 - Joy Comes with the Morning
description:
Through Jesus’ death and resurrection, God draws near to sinners and enjoys fellowship with us once more. Let us praise him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 29 - Ascribe to the Lord Glory
description:
Has the awe-inspiring greatness of God displayed in unspeakable majesty and strength been pressed into your heart? If not, this psalm helps to do so.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 28 - The Lord Is My Strength and My Shield
description:
David does not expend his energies engaging his enemies or defending himself or pursuing any other humanly contrived strategy. He receives the horizontal affliction but goes to a vertical solution.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 27 - The Lord Is My Light and My Salvation
description:
If the Lord is your light and salvation, of whom will you be afraid?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 26 - I Will Bless the Lord
description:
David knows that he can count on the Lord to deliver him because this is who God has always been for his people.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 25 - Teach Me Your Paths
description:
When life overwhelms us, when the bottom is falling out, this is where Scripture takes us: to God. We do not achieve internal calm by securing external calm. We find internal calm by looking to God.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 24 - The King of Glory
description:
For, in the fullness of time, the high and lofty God came near to his people, tangibly near, in flesh and blood.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Introducing the ESV Concise Study Bible
description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/bibles/esv-concise-study-bibletrade-hc/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 23 - The Lord Is My Shepherd
description:
We know that Jesus Christ walked through the ultimate valley of the shadow of death, the darkness of condemnation and hell—a fate that should have landed on us. The result is that in our temporary dark valleys we can know that despite our sin and failure, God will bring us, in full moral integrity, to be with him forever.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 22 - Why Have You Forsaken Me?
description:
David assumes God has forsaken him. He does not ask God if he has forsaken him. He asks why, assuming God already has. Yet in light of the promises made to David in Scripture, David ought to have known that God would never have finally forsaken him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 21 - The King Rejoices in the Lord’s Strength
description:
David rejoices in God’s goodness to him as the anointed king. But his own rule would quickly fade from history. A greater King, however, would one day come. Unlike David’s temporary “crown of fine gold”, this King’s reign would last forever.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 20 - Trust in the Name of the Lord Our God
description:
God alone is able to bear the weight of our deepest trust. And God alone will never let us down when we place the full weight of our trust on him. In Christ he proved it.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 19 - The Law of the Lord Is Perfect
description:
The Word of God not only reveals who God is; it also reveals who we are, in all our sin and need. The lofty call of Scripture is worthy of all pursuit, yet frustratingly beyond our reach in light of our weakness and inadequacy.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 18 - The Lord Is My Rock and My Fortress
description:
We can trust God, no matter how dire the circumstance. For in the gospel the direst of circumstances—our deserved condemnation and an eternity in hell—have already been emptied of their threat and power.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 17 - In the Shadow of Your Wings
description:
Whatever unfolds in this life, David knows that one day he will be at rest in the presence of the Lord.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 16 - You Will Not Abandon My Soul
description:
The ringing note on which the psalm ends has been deeply calming encouragement to saints down through the ages. “In your presence there is fullness of joy; at your right hand are pleasures forevermore”. Nothing else is needed. 

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 15 - Who Shall Dwell on Your Holy Hill?
description:
To dwell on God’s holy mountain means to pass into and abide in the temple. But Jesus did not come simply to the temple; he came as the temple.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 14 - The Fool Says, There Is No God
description:
Sin is universal. No one is exempt. But grace is universally available. No one need be exempt. All that is required is a trusting faith in Jesus Christ.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 13 - How Long, O Lord?
description:
If David can bank everything on God, even when on the brink of despair, how much more can we today?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 12 - The Faithful Have Vanished
description:
God delights to rescue us in our need. How do we know this? Because in Christ he’s already achieved the greatest deliverance and accomplished our greatest safety—deliverance from hell and condemnation, safety from Satan and eternal death.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 11 - The Lord Is in His Holy Temple
description:
What does it mean that believers will see the face of God? It means we will become ourselves, finally. It means dawn will rise on the dark gray of this fallen world. It means final rest will be ours. It means we will be with the One of whom even the best earthly friendships are only a faint glimpse and to whom the most sublime earthly joys are finally pointing.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 10 - Why Do You Hide Yourself?
description:
God sent his own Son, the one man who was ever truly just, to go to a cross and swallow all of the injustice of all of those who would simply trust in him.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 9 - I Will Recount Your Wonderful Deeds
description:
God is never caught by surprise amid global upheaval and strife. He is never perplexed or left groping for solutions. He reigns. And one day, all that is done in this stormy world will be brought into the light and into judgment.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 8 - How Majestic Is Your Name
description:
David brings us to praise God for the remarkable care he has entrusted to us. He is the God of the heavens, having placed the stars in their orbits, and yet he has entrusted to humanity the care of the earth.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 7 - In You Do I Take Refuge
description:
David is not putting on blinders to his own sinfulness; rather, he is asking for truth and objective honesty to be pursued.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Jesus's Love in the Midst of Sexual Sin
description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/the-death-of-porn-tpb/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 6 - O Lord, Deliver My Life
description:
When we are brought into the dark valleys of life as we journey through this fallen world, we have, and we need, one thing: God. And we can know that we have the Lord with us, moment by moment, because he sent his own Son to walk through this world’s sorrows.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 5 - Lead Me in Your Righteousness
description:
Content to leave the punishment of all evil in God’s hands, David directs his heart elsewhere. He does not let thoughts of evildoers fester in his mind but finally rests in God, his refuge.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 4 - Answer Me When I Call
description:
In the darkness of this moment, David makes up his mind: he will trust in the Lord. The result? A greater joy than any material prosperity could ever provide; a peace that supplies contented sleep.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 3 - Save Me, O My God
description:
What strengthens David is not strength mustered up from within. What stabilizes him is not self-generated optimism. David knows that earthly help is worthless when the tidal waves of life threaten to overwhelm and drown us. Instead he looks to God.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 2 - The Reign of the Lord’s Anointed
description:
Believers today are the heirs of this psalm, and its promises come to rest on the worldwide church and its faith in the true and final Davidic heir, Jesus.

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: In the Lord I Take Refuge: Psalm 1 - The Way of the Righteous and the Wicked
description:
Beneath the never-ending list of “to do’s” clamoring for our attention lies the fundamental choice to receive instruction and influence either from God or from fools. Will we listen to the voice of life or to the voices of death?

Find out more: https://www.crossway.org/articles/crossway-podcasts/

title: Why the Church can Rest in Christ's Victory
description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/how-to-build-a-healthy-church-tpb/

description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/how-to-build-a-healthy-church-tpb/

title: The Biblical Basis for Church Membership
description: Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/rediscover-church-tpb/

title: ESV Bible, Read by Kristyn Getty

title: What Does It Mean to be Fearfully and Wonderfully Made?

title: Don't Define Gender Apart from the Bible
description:
In this video, Sam Allberry discusses gender. 

Sam Allberry is the associate pastor at Immanuel Nashville. He is the author of various books, including One with My Lord; What God Has to Say about Our Bodies; and Is God Anti-Gay?, and the cohost of the podcast You’re Not Crazy: Gospel Sanity for Young Pastors. He is a fellow at the Keller Center for Cultural Apologetics.

There’s a danger in focusing too much on the body. There’s also a danger in not valuing it enough. In fact, the Bible has lots to say about the body. With the coming of Jesus, “The Word became flesh and dwelt among us”—flesh that was pierced and crushed for the sins of the world.

In What God Has to Say about Our Bodies, Sam Allberry explains that all of us are fearfully and wonderfully made, and should regard our physicality as a gift. He offers biblical guidance for living, including understanding gender, sexuality, and identity; dealing with aging, illness, and death; and considering the physical future hope that we have in Christ.

In this powerfully written book, you’ll gain a new understanding for the immeasurable value of our bodies and God’s ultimate plan to redeem them.

❖ Check out ‘What God Has to Say about Our Bodies’ here: www.crossway.org/books/what-god-has-to-say-about-our-bodies-tpb/ 

❖ For more resources from Crossway, check our website: https://www.crossway.org/  

❖ Follow us on social media to stay up to date:
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/crosswaybooks/
Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/CrosswayBooks/
X: https://x.com/crossway
Threads: https://www.threads.net/@crosswaybooks

title: Emblems of the Infinite King Podcast: Credits
description:
In an imaginative journey through the grand story of the universe, 'Emblems of the Infinite King' introduces kids ages 10+ to God’s radiant beauty using the main categories of systematic theology: God, humanity, sin, Christ, the Holy Spirit, salvation, the church, and last things. Full of captivating illustrated “emblems” meant to symbolize key facets of Christian doctrine, this unique book seeks to bring theological truths from words to life. The creative design combined with rich theology will challenge young readers to search God’s Word for important answers to big questions about themselves, God, and the gospel.

Print Book: crossway.org/books/emblems-of-the-infinite-king-case/
Audio Book: crossway.org/books/emblems-of-the-infinite-king-dl/
More Podcasts: crossway.org/Podcasts

Full of captivating illustrated “emblems” meant to symbolize key facets of Christian doctrine, this unique book seeks to bring theological truths from words to life. The creative design combined with rich theology will challenge young readers to search God’s Word for important answers to big questions about themselves, God, and the gospel.

Audio Book: crossway.org/books/emblems-of-the-infinite-king-dl/

title: Coronavirus and Christ (John Piper)
description:
In this special bonus episode, we're sharing a full audio recording of 'Coronavirus and Christ'—a brand-new book written and read by John Piper.

On January 11, 2020, a novel coronavirus (COVID-19) reportedly claimed its first victim in the Wuhan province of China. By March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization had declared a global pandemic. In the midst of this fear and uncertainty, it is natural to wonder what God is doing.

In this audiobook read by the author, John Piper invites listeners around the world to stand on the solid Rock, who is Jesus Christ, in whom our souls can be sustained by the sovereign God who ordains, governs, and reigns over all things to accomplish his wise and good purposes for those who trust in him. What is God doing through the coronavirus? Piper offers six biblical answers to that question, showing us that God is at work in this moment in history.

Learn more about 'Coronavirus and Christ' and download the full ebook for free at crossway.org/CoronavirusAndChrist

title: Day 14: Rich in Mercy (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to the saints who are in Ephesus, and care faithful in Christ Jesus: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places, even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and blameless before him. In love he predestined us for adoption to himself as sons through Jesus Christ, according to the purpose of his will, to the praise of his glorious grace, with which he has blessed us in the Beloved.
—Ephesians 1:1-6 (ESV.org/Ephesians1)


Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay14

title: Day 9: Our Advocate (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
If we say we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness. If we say we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us. My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous.
—1 John 1:8-2:1 (ESV.org/1John1)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay9

title: Day 8: Saved to the Uttermost (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
This makes Jesus the guarantor of a better covenant. The former priests were many in number, because they were prevented by death from continuing in office, but he holds his priesthood permanently, because he continues forever. Consequently, he is able to save to the uttermost those who draw near to God through him, since he always lives to make intercession for them
—Hebrews 7:22-25 (ESV.org/Hebrews7)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay8

title: Day 7: Grace Reigns (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
Now the law came in to increase the trespass, but where sin increased, grace abounded all the more, so that, as sin reigned in death, grace also might reign through righteousness leading to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
—Romans 5:20-21 (ESV.org/Romans5)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay7

title: Day 6: Never Cast Out (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst. But I said to you that you have seen me and yet do not believe. All that the Father gives me will come to me, and whoever comes to me I will never cast out.
—John 6:35–37 (ESV.org/John6)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay6

title: Day 5: Beset with Weakness (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
Let us then with confidence draw near to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need. For every high priest chosen from among men is appointed to act on behalf of men in relation to God, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins. He can deal gently with the ignorant and wayward, since he himself is beset with weakness.
—Hebrews 4:16-5:2 (ESV.org/Hebrews4)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay5

title: Day 4: Draw Near (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but one who in every respect has been tempted as we are, yet without sin. Let us then with confidence draw near to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
—Hebrews 4:15-16 (ESV.org/Hebrews4)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay4

title: Day 3: For the Joy Set Before Him (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is seated at the right hand of the throne of God.
—Hebrews 12:1–2 (ESV.org/Hebrews12)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay3

title: Day 2: The Touch of Compassion (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
And Jesus went throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom and healing every disease and every affliction. When he saw the crowds, he had compassion for them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
—Matthew 9:35-36 (ESV.org/Matthew9)

Find the full transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay2

title: Day 1: Gentle and Lowly in Heart (Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional)
description:
Passage:
Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls. For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
—Matthew 11:28-30 (ESV.org/Matthew11)

Find the transcript here: crossway.org/GentleAndLowlyDay1

title: Introducing Gentle and Lowly: A 14-Day Devotional Podcast
description:
The Gentle and Lowly podcast is a 14-day audio devotional exploring the heart of Christ for sinners and sufferers. Join Dane Ortlund—author of 'Gentle and Lowly: The Heart of Christ for Sinners and Sufferers'—each day for a brief Scripture reading as well as a devotional meditation on a different aspect of the heart of Christ, as he helps you discover afresh not just what Jesus has done for you but how he feels about you as his beloved.

Learn more: www.crossway.org/gentleandlowlypodcast/

title: The Difference Between Fallen and Unfallen Angels
description:
In this video, Graham Cole discusses the difference between fallen and unfallen angels. 

Graham A. Cole is emeritus dean and emeritus professor of biblical and systematic theology at Trinity Evangelical Divinity School. An ordained Anglican minister, he has served in two parishes and was formerly the principal of Ridley College. He is the author of 'Against the Darkness: The Doctrine of Angels, Satan, and Demons.'  This book explores the doctrine of angels and demons, answering key questions about their nature and the implications for Christians’ beliefs and behavior, helping readers see their place in the larger biblical plotline that includes supernatural beings. An understanding of the reality of angels and demons encourages believers to be vigilant in the light of spiritual warfare and to be confident in Christ’s victory on the cross.

❖ Check out ‘Against the Darkness: The Doctrine of Angels, Satan, and Demons’ here: https://www.crossway.org/books/against-the-darkness-case/

title: Digging into Bible Study with Jen Wilkin: Day 1
description:
At the start of this five-day series, Jen Wilkin discusses how to study the Bible with both our hearts and our minds.

Jen Wilkin is a Bible teacher from Dallas, Texas. As an advocate for biblical literacy, she has organized and led studies for women in home, church, and parachurch contexts and authored multiple books, including the best seller "Women of the Word". With over 250,000 copies sold, "Women of the Word" has helped countless women with a clear and concise plan they can use every time they open their Bible. Featuring the same content as the first edition, and now with added study questions at the end of each chapter, this book equips you to engage God’s word in a way that trains your mind and transforms your heart.

Check out “Women of the Word: How to Study the Bible with Both Our Hearts and Our Minds” here: https://www.crossway.org/books/women-of-the-word-tpb-2/

title: Paul Miller’s Story of Learning to Love
description:
Learn more: crossway.org/books/j-curve-tpb/

Paul Miller, author and founder of SeeJesus, a global discipling mission, tells the story of how he learned to love through seasons of suffering in his own family. Through his family’s own trials, he came to realize that loving people isn’t always efficient, but rather, it requires you slow down and be present and attentive. Paul shares his own journey of learning this kind of love from the pattern of Jesus's life.



Music Courtesy of MusicBed
MB01LYG2RIFLYJM

title: What Tom Brady Can Teach Us about Contentment
description: Here’s a guy who has more money than he or his children will ever need, he’s been named MVP multiple times, he’s won five Super Bowl rings, he’s married to a supermodel, he has a beautiful house—he has it all. From a human perspective, he’s climbed to the top of the mountain. But it’s like he’s scratching his head with his five Super Bowl rings, grumbling, and saying, “There’s got to be more than this.”

title: What Does the Bible Really Teach about Homosexuality?
description:
In this message, recorded at College Church in Wheaton, Illinois on March 17, 2015, pastor and author Kevin DeYoung addresses a difficult and often controversial topic: what does the Bible really teach about homosexuality?

Kevin DeYoung is the senior pastor at Christ Covenant Church in Matthews, North Carolina, and associate professor of systematic theology at Reformed Theological Seminary, Charlotte. To hear more from him check out his book "What Does the Bible Really Teach about Homosexuality?". After examining key biblical passages in both the Old and New Testaments and the Bible’s overarching teaching regarding sexuality, DeYoung responds to popular objections raised by Christians and non-Christians alike, making this an indispensable resource for thinking through one of the most pressing issues of our day.

Check out “What Does the Bible Really Teach about Homosexuality?” here: https://www.crossway.org/books/what-does-the-bible-really-teach-about-tpb/ 

❖ Download a free excerpt: cway.to/1H64LPx

❖ For more resources from Crossway, check our website: https://www.crossway.org/

description:
Many of us are too intimidated to read the classics on our own. Crossway’s Christian Guides to the Classics series is designed to help readers enjoy the greatest literature in history with the aid of a gifted teacher to answer questions along the way. Popular professor, author, and literary expert Leland Ryken situates each work in its cultural context, incorporates published criticism, includes brief bibliographies for further study, and successfully evaluates the classic text from a Christian worldview through analytic commentary.

Learn more:

Shakespeare's Macbeth: crossway.org/books/shakespeares-imacbethi-tpb/

title: How Catechisms Help Us Take Life as It Comes
description:
'The New City Catechism' lays out 52 questions and answers related to God, human nature, sin, Christ, the Holy Spirit, and more.

Whether used devotionally, recited orally, or memorized over the course of a year, families, churches, small groups, and Christian schools will treasure this as a valuable tool for teaching the core doctrines of the Christian faith to children and adults alike.

Learn more: NewCityCatechism.com

The Problem With Theistic Evolution
description:
Many prominent Christians insist that the church must yield to contemporary evolutionary theory and therefore modify traditional biblical ideas about the creation of life. They argue that God used—albeit in an undetectable way—evolutionary mechanisms to produce all forms of life. Featuring two dozen highly credentialed scientists, philosophers, and theologians from Europe and North America, this volume contests this proposal, documenting evidential, logical, and theological problems with theistic evolution—making it the most comprehensive critique of theistic evolution yet produced.

Learn more: https://www.crossway.org/books/theistic-evolution-case-2/

title: Does your church make you uncomfortable?
description:
Uncomfortable: The Awkward and Essential Challenge of Christian Community

Producers: Josh Dennis, Jon Marshall
Director: Micah Lanier
Sound: Adam Billingham
Editor, FX: Micah Lanier

About the book:
It’s easy to dream about the “perfect” church—a church that sings just the right songs set to just the right music before the pastor preaches just the right sermon to a room filled with just the right mix of people who happen to agree with you on just about everything.

Chances are your church doesn’t quite look like that. But what if instead of searching for a church that makes us comfortable, we learned to love our church, even when it’s challenging? What if some of the discomfort that we often experience is actually good for us?

This book is a call to embrace the uncomfortable aspects of Christian community, whether that means believing difficult truths, pursuing difficult holiness, or loving difficult people—all for the sake of the gospel, God’s glory, and our joy.

Learn more: crossway.org/books/uncomfortable-tpb/

title: Introducing the ESV Systematic Theology Study Bible
description:
Theology should, first and foremost, be rooted in God’s Word.

Producers: Josh Dennis, Jon Marshall
Director, Editor: Tim Kellner
Production Assistant: Isra G. Vazz
Narration: Dane Ortlund
Script: Adam Billingham
Shot on the Sony A7S-II in Wheaton, IL

About the Bible:
The goal of the ESV Systematic Theology Study Bible is to demonstrate how all Christian doctrine arises from the pages of the Bible. Created to help readers understand how Scripture forms the basis for our understanding of God, humanity, sin, salvation, and eternity, this study Bible features over 300 short in-text doctrinal summaries connecting Christian beliefs to specific Bible passages, 25 longer articles explaining important theological topics in greater depth, and introductions to each book of the Bible that highlight the unique ways each book contributes to the whole of Christian theology. Created by an outstanding team of editors and 26 contributors, this resource has been created to help Christians better connect what they believe about God with the very words of Scripture.

Learn more: crossway.org/bibles/esv-systematic-theology-study-bible-hcj/
